newsitem.title: USA: EDS CEO comfortable with Q3 estimates.
newsitem.headline: EDS CEO comfortable with Q3 estimates.

text.p: Electronic Data Systems (EDS) Corp chairman and chief executive officer Lester Alberthal said he was "comfortable" with consensus estimates that the company will earn $0.55 per share in the third quarter.
"We're still comfortable with where the analysts are," he told Reuters after a speech to the Japan-U.S. Southern Conference here.

Alberthal said the Dallas-based data processing firm, which was spun off from General Motors Corp in June, planned to do "a lot of smaller acquisitions that are geographically focused, industry focused, or (offer a) particular talent or expertise.
"It's got to be an expansion or extension of what we do. But there aren't that many opportunities out there as far as acquisitions now," he said.
